alert.note: Alert for Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 9:00AM EDT until September 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Marion and Horry Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Northeast Cape Fear River near Burgaw. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Floodwater causes roads to become impassable in the River Bend, River Birch and Alligator Lake subdivisions off Highway 53. These areas become isolated due to the floodwater and some evacuations may be needed. In the Holly Shelter Estates subdivision, half of the area has water on the roads due to floodwater. Approximately 12 homes on Old Maple Hill Road off Shaw Highway become isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday evening and continue falling to 7.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by late tonight.
